mods.abstract: A Runaway in Jail. WAS committed into the Jail of the Parish of St. Landry, on the 12th of September instant, a mulatto man calling himself WILLIAM, and saying he belongs to one William Clark, residing on Canal Street, in New-Orleans, from whom he ranaway in November or December last. William is 5 feet 6 inches high, has rings in his ears, wears whiskers, is between 40 and 45 years old, and speak English and French. The owner is requested to come forward, prove property, pay charges and take him away, otherwise he will be disposed of after the legal delay. CHS. THOMPSON, Jailor. Opelousas, September 19, 1857.

recordInfo.recordOrigin: Transformed into MODS from extended Dublin Core by the LDL Development Team at Louisiana State University.
